definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: Head and chest circumference are checked on all children under two years of age.
sentences.chinese: 两岁以下的婴儿都应测量头围和胸围。

sentences.english: I would like to buy the brassiere when they provide discount.
sentences.chinese: 折扣优惠让我想购买胸围。

sentences.english: Stone Portrait Create a "Stone Bust" out of a portrait for a killer special effect.
sentences.chinese: 石人像创建一个杀手一“石胸围”出画像特殊效果。

sentences.english: Make a note of your measurement and add 5 inches. That's your chest size.
sentences.chinese: 记录下测量结果然后加上5寸，那就是你的胸围了。

sentences.english: Was that a brassier over Holly's shoulder this morning?
sentences.chinese: 今天早上霍莉肩上挂的是“胸围”？

sentences.english: Maybe we can finally resolve the mystery of her fluctuating breast size.
sentences.chinese: 也许我们可以弄明白布兰妮那波动的胸围是怎么回事。

sentences.english: Statistics on average chest size were  unavailable.
sentences.chinese: 目前无法得到平均胸围的统计数据。

sentences.english: So how do you calculate your chest and cup measurements?
sentences.chinese: 所以，你如何来测算你的胸围和罩杯大小呢？

sentences.english: Bra fitting experts offer two methods of calculating the chest measurement.
sentences.chinese: 胸罩研究专家分享了两种方法来测量胸围。

sentences.english: The average jacket chest size is 42 inches.
sentences.chinese: 夹克的平均胸围是42英寸。

sentences.english: Please turn round and let me measure your chest.
sentences.chinese: 请你转过来让我量量胸围。

definition: BWH, abbr. for a woman's three measurements, namely: bust 胸圍|胸围[xiong1 wei2], waist 腰圍|腰围[yao1 wei2] and hip 臀圍|臀围[tun2 wei2]
(of a woman) to have nice curves/buxom/shapely
